content: old bean hat by polly outhwaite www alltangledup com size it s stretchy so will fit most adult sized heads gauge 18stsx24row over 10cm/ in square materials 1 x100g jaeger shetland aran or 2 x 50g jaeger chamonix 4 x 4 5mm dpns or 4 5mm 60cm circular modelled by kris who was quite taken with the hat so taken that he wouldn t give it back to my father the brown hat is knitted in jaeger chamonix i knitted it tighter so that it was at an aran gauge the grey hat was knitted using jaeger shetland now discontinued this is a very simple watch cap pattern written for aran weight yarn it s such a great stand-by that i ve done it 3 times i call it the old bean hat because the first one that i made was for my dad and i call him lo dull cantonese for father which sounds just like old bean as a general guideline i used approx 125g of the jaeger shetland aran for 2 hats so if you have 2 balls of this yarn you should be able to make 3 hats why is this important because yarn is usually available in 50g balls and you will very likely need more than 1 ball stitches used 2x2 rib *k2 p2* repeat * to * stocking stitch knit every round instructions cast on 80 stitches using long tail method work 2 inches 2x2 rib *k2 p2* repeat * to * work 5 5 inches in stocking stitch start crown round 1 *k2 decrease k6* repeat * to * 10 times round 2 and all even rounds k round 3 *k2tog k5* repeat * to * 10 times round 5 *k2tog k4* repeat * to * 10 times round 7 *k2tog k3* repeat * to * 10 times round 9 *k2tog k2* repeat * to * 10 times round 11 *k2tog k1* repeat * to * 10 times round 13 *k2tog* repeat * to * 10 times leaving a 6 inch tail cut yarn and thread through the 10 remaining stitches secure yarn by darning into the hat copyright ©2008 all rights reserved by polly outhwaite a pattern for non-commercial use only available on www alltangledup com -
